title: Art Demo images from Arma and PAX 2014!
body:
Hey guys! 
I'm putting up the finished versions of the two images from Armageddon and PAX Aus here so they are available for download. A huge thanks to everyone that came out and visited the Riot area!

I will be around for a bit to answer art questions about the new Summoner's Rift or art questions in general - feel free to ask! I will also do my best to check in as much as possible.

replies.body:
I enjoyed watching your art unfold each day I visited. I also like the stylistic approach with vivid colurs instead and a more cartoony appearance, and yes, we do need Koala Poros so badly! Haha.

Also, it was great talking about jobs at Riot, and I still need to get back to you about that! Just been so busy as of late.

Edit : Also, you were using a Cintiq yeah? (What model? I'm curious)
Hey Queue! Thanks for asking - I was using a Cintiq 22HD.
Hey man just wanna say these look amazing :D. Was great to get to meet you at Armageddon Expo, such an honour ^_^
hey earp! dunno if you remember me man but i thoroughly enjoyed looking at you draw for the 3 days of pax and the end result is amazing, love your work brother
I probably won't remember names but faces :) Thank you for coming by and see you next year!
ahahahhahaha yea no worries man, i'll definitely come by next year and watch the genius at work  :'D

I still think in that PAX piece, those shrooms are gonna blow out those tires mate. So if you did a follow up piece, I'm picturing a flat tire scenario and Blitzcrank being the jack, lifting up the car. What are your thoughts on that?
Please make it happen

> I still think in that PAX piece, those shrooms are gonna blow out those tires mate. So if you did a follow up piece, I'm picturing a flat tire scenario and Blitzcrank being the jack, lifting up the car. What are your thoughts on that?

Haha, there definitely needs to be a Part II to this piece. Maybe Piltover Customs Heimerdinger fixing it up...and hopefully someone has killed Teemo by now.
Hey Earp! I was at the PentaMagic stall in Auckland where you got the sick Sid sketch. Was awesome meeting you dude. What has been your favorite piece of work used in League so far?

Hey LOLOL MASTER! It was great to meet you too! I haven't forgotten about the TF sketch. My favorite piece of work is probably the Jinx video haha - or the Shurima art from the promo video - all super stylish with tons of character :)
I think you forgot fizz and gnar in yordle town{{champion:150}} {{champion:105}}  oh and does kog maw count?
I know! I wanted to do a Veigar one as well, but just ran out of time :( I think Kog is technically from the Void...but he deserves a house too.
Aww, maybe you can do that on 2015.

> I think you forgot fizz and gnar in yordle town{{champion:150}} {{champion:105}}  oh and does kog maw count?

Fizz and Kog'Maw aren't Yordles.

Hey RiotEarp, thanks so much for uploading the finished pieces here! Really cool getting to see it made across all 3 days and was great talking to such a chill and friendly guy like yourself.

Now that I've played a bit of the new rift I really want to know what parts in particular you worked on most and what's your own favourite part of it? Any chance of changing the frog to actually be cool? My favourite parts are the southern quadrant and reds base, and I love the raptors and bristlebacks! So cool.

Also, who is your favourite champion? and do you have many online resources for reference and learning different anatomy?

Thanks again for showing off your cool as art skills. I was the guy with brown hair and black glasses at PAX and thanks for putting up with me hanging around watching on from behind across all those days!

Hey RiotEarp :D Just wanna say thanks for signing my Mecha{{champion:121}}  at Armageddon NZ, makes me feel like it's worth something now haha xD Next time, maybe you can sign my {{champion:238}}  painting too ;) (If I can be bothered to bring it)

These are awesome! wish I could have gone to the expos. How did you get into the industry? (did you study art, or was it a hobby that you just had talent for?)

What is one piece of advice you would give to someone looking to get into designing graphics or creating art for games?

i went to an art school, but a lot of people I know of are self-taught. I think it all comes down to putting the time in and doing a ton of drawing, and building up your mental vocabulary of real-world references - human anatomy, animal anatomy, architecture, nature, mechanics, etc. There are tons of  online tutorials out there as well for resources - let me know if you need some links!
I wish I could have been there at PAX. Can you tell me when the Ute champion/Item/Spell is being added to the Rift?
Haha, it would always have to carry a bunch of Koala Poros that give out buffs maybe :)

Hey there,

I didn't get to ask at PAX, but I had an awesome idea on an OCE skin which I think will appeal globally and I wanted to ask for your thoughts!

I wanted to know what do you think about an **Australian themed Gnar skin**?

Gnar by lore is already quite tribal and throws a boomerang and I think it'll be really easy to fit in some Australian themes in there by adjusting his look to be more Australian. He could maybe be a hopping kangaroo/wallaby with his Yordle form (fits well with his bounce skill and maybe you can make his walking animation bouncy too) and as for his Mega-Gnar form, he could be some kind of wombat or frilled neck lizard or some mythical Australian beast (eg. Yowie; basically an Australian version of big foot).

What do you think of this skin idea? Do you think it has potential to not only fit well for the OCE region, but also be appealing enough globally to make it a worthwhile skin to make?
I think it's a great idea, and worthy of some concept iteration. We have a big lineup of skins always in the works, but let me add this idea to the brainstorm!

Dont know if you will see this but thanks for the advice you have me during your time at PAX. For you to have liked what I had done was a massive thing for me being someone who takes this as a hobby. (Don't know if you will remember but it was the nidalee.). Your tips have only helped my art come further and watching your style was amazing. Thanks from a fan.
Nidalee! Of course :) Thank you for wanting to show me your work. It's great to meet other artists that are into League!
Those Yordle houses look awesome! I could just imagine Mega {{champion:150}}  smashing them to bits in a tantrum haha.

Thanks Prima! 
I can picture Gnar smashing his own little house by accident. What would his house look like???? Hmmmm.

> Thanks Prima! 
> I can picture Gnar smashing his own little house by accident. What would his house look like???? Hmmmm.

Not sure. Maybe it would look prehistoric cave like, so he feels at home since he's still really young and probably misses his home.
Thanks for the new wallpaper! Love your work. So sad I couldn't go to PAX living in NZ and all.
Hope to see you next year Zastarx :)
